etymology.description: Depicts a stretched animal hide: head and tail/legs visible with hands briefly added
etymology.interpretation: The character 革(革) (gé, "change") originally depicted a stretched animal hide, emphasizing the transformation process involved in treatment of the hide. Over time, this visual representation came to symbolize broader transformations or changes.

examples.chinese: 公司需要革新(公司需要革新)，才能适应市场变化(才能適應市場變化)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī xūyào géxīn，cái néng shìyìng shìchǎng biànhuà。
examples.english: The company needs to innovate in order to adapt to market changes.

examples.chinese: 我们应当革除旧习(我們應當革除舊習)，采纳新理念(採納新理念)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yīngdāng géchú jiùxí，cǎinà xīn lǐniàn。
examples.english: We should abolish old practices and adopt new ideas.

examples.chinese: 时代在革(時代在革)，记录着巨变(記錄著巨變)。
examples.english: The era is changing, recording tremendous transformations.
